title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Board came in previously ultrasonically cleaned but not super well. There was remanence of corrosion on the bios on pins 7 and 8. Touched up soldering and have continuity from pins 7 and 8 to their corresponding spots. Measured around a bit and noticed PPVRTC_G3H would kind of jump between 3.3 and 3.42. Replaced clock chip now only goes to 3.3 like normal, but it still refuses to start. It doesn't quickly quarter spin but rather it will do the on off on off on thing like 3437's normally do; however, it never stops going on off on off. Could this be a result of crap under a chip like the SMC or where should I look next? The termination resistors around the bios look pretty normal like no burning but have not measured them yet. JTAG looks clean as can be.

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: CPU Vcore also pulses????

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Did not check CPU Vcore yet. I would assume so, but I will do that when I get back to the board

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: As Duke always says, this could be anything, corrosion somewhere, under CPU, SMC,traces and/or resistors on SPI>SMC or SPI>CPU, U1900 (replaced)...

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: I kinda figured as much. Going to do what I can these people who sent it to us get a sweet deal (aka we don't make shit) so spending more than an hour on their stuff is really not the best idea. Going to check tho if CPU Vcore is cycling what would that mean?

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: If CPU Vcore pulses then it is usually U6100 and termination resistor/traces problem.

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Ok will check that. I'm going to guess it will pulse seeing as there was corrosion left on the ROM

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: All the rails kind of fluctuate once the fan comes on. For example if the fan goes off PPBUS goes to 8.38 then once the fan comes on it stabilizes to 8.59. CPU Vcore will go all the way to zero when the fan is off then pulse as high as 3.7 volts then stabilize when the fan spins at 1.75

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Wasn't stuff under the SMC tried that.

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Corroded traces to U6100 are most likely at this point. Check all termination resistors and traces going to U6100.

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Termination resistors and traces are good. HOWEVER, I just found that I never get 3v42 on U1950 at ALL. Does this mean U1950 is fucked or does this mean there is something up with 3v42? I do get a steady orange light at all times

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Actually nevermind I got it scratch that. I did measure the resistors and traces and every single one of them connects :(

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: I'm going to jump pins 7 and 8 and see tho. The trace doesn't look burned at all, but that was where the original corrosion was when I got the board

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: No change. Every single trace on the BIOS connects to its corresponding spot. Same with resistors. They all measure in spec, and there are no obviously fucked probe points really on the entire board for that matter.

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Can you take a good hires picture of U6100 area?

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: No Title

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: I assume you already ripped off J6100? Pull the BIOS chip and do a diode mode reading on each pin. Try another known good BIOS for testing, can be from 3435 or 3437.

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Yes JTAG has been eradicated lol. I will post diode mode readings tomorrow and try known good bios.

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Swapped ROMs and still doing it. I'm gonna call this one because don't have a lot of time left with this one. Any other ides what could cause it? Rest of board looks very clean

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Only thing I'm still suspecting is a problem around U6100. Still not seen the diode mode readings.

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: Crap forgot to post that. I tested it next to another 3435 they sent in for no backlight and every single pin was within .001 or .002 of each other, so I think traces were fine. I also tested them for continuity with the chip off just to give myself peace of mind that I wasn't getting a wrong reading with the chip on. So yeah, everything else was normal and even a test chip didn't fix it :/

title: 820-3435 Tries to turn on can't, quarter spin
message: If CPU Vcore is coming up and U1950 is looking fine then it could be pretty much anything else. Inspect corroded areas for well.....corrosion..
